description.narrative: The thematic assessment improves the planning of FCA?s operations and ensures that the thematic context where the work is/will be undertaken is analysed hand in hand with FCA?s strategy. The outcome of the thematic assessment should be a clear picture of h ow FCA?s thematic priorities, including synergies between themes, can best be achieved in the operating context and what adjustments will be needed in our own programming. The thematic assessment can be utilised to aid in decision-making in mainly two situ ations:? When FCA is planning to establish a new operations in a new geographic area, or developing the programme, e.g. new initiatives within thematic areas, and? If the current FCA country programme or geographic operations need to be reassessed and poss ibly repositioned.The overall objective is to improve effectiveness, quality and impact of programming by conducting thematic assessments to be able to develop the thematic focus in respective countries of the regional programme. Activities: Organising a nd facilitating thematic assessments in Right to Education, Right to Peace and Right to Livelihood in the programme countries. The assessments will be conducted by FCA/a consultant
